item.title: The Maintenance phase
item.description: This phase ensures that software remains robust, relevant, and valuable throughout its lifecycle1. Software maintenance encompasses all activities post-deployment that are not categorized as software evolution2. It’s about refining, enhancing, and optimizing software, as well as fixing errors that surface over time. While creating software is challenging, maintaining it is often even more demanding. With changing user needs, technology advancements, and the inevitable emergence of bugs, ongoing maintenance is essential for software’s continued relevance and efficiency1.
